feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 11 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 9 - Evidence suggests asynchronous updates or synchronization considerations. - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: Current payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days
findings.issue_explanation: The system cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days per month
findings.limitation_statement: Unable to automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking
findings.gap_statement: Missing automated, attendance-driven salary calculation capability

findings.group_description: End of Service (EOS) pro-rated amount calculation produces consistently slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision errors
findings.issue_explanation: When calculating daily wage for pro-rated EOS amounts, the system shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals, affecting all employees regardless of departure date
findings.limitation_statement: The platform's daily wage calculation engine has limited decimal precision when computing pro-rated salary amounts
findings.gap_statement: Enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms are needed to ensure exact financial calculations

findings.group_description: System's handling of leap year days in gratuity calculation causes minor computational differences
findings.issue_explanation: The platform's gratuity calculation method does not transparently handle February 29th inclusion, leading to slight variations in total service days calculation
findings.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not clearly defined or consistently applied
findings.gap_statement: Need for clear documentation explaining how leap year days are counted in service duration and gratuity calculations

findings.group_description: Users can manually edit system-generated gratuity calculations without clear validation
findings.issue_explanation: The system allows manual editing of gratuity amounts, potentially introducing discrepancies between automated and user-modified calculations
findings.limitation_statement: No robust validation mechanism exists to prevent potentially incorrect manual edits to gratuity calculations
findings.gap_statement: Need for a mechanism to validate or flag manually edited gratuity amounts

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator has a fixed calculation methodology that cannot be customized by clients
findings.issue_explanation: Platform uses a hardcoded daily wage calculation of (Basic Salary / 30), which differs from some client preferences like (Basic Salary × 12 / 365)
findings.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation method is fixed and cannot be configured or modified by users
findings.gap_statement: No flexibility exists to customize daily wage computation formula across different organizational calculation preferences

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations with limited flexibility for month-specific variations.
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary based on a fixed daily rate configuration in the leave policy, which may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
findings.limitation_statement: Users cannot override the standard daily wage calculation method or adjust the divisor based on specific month characteristics.
findings.gap_statement: The platform lacks transparency in explaining how leave salary calculations are performed, particularly regarding daily rate divisor configurations.

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator uses separate configurations for leave salary and salary proration, causing calculation discrepancies.
findings.issue_explanation: Leave salary and salary proration use independent daily wage formulas with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), leading to inconsistent calculations.
findings.limitation_statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned.
findings.gap_statement: There is no unified daily wage calculation method that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

findings.group_description: Inconsistent salary proration logic for employees with future departure dates during payroll processing
findings.issue_explanation: When an employee's departure date is in the future, the system fails to correctly prorate salary, displaying the full monthly amount instead of a prorated calculation
findings.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculator cannot handle salary proration for employees with departure dates different from the current payroll processing date
findings.gap_statement: The system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic that can dynamically calculate salaries for employees with future departure dates

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator has a display issue with remarks for unpaid leave deduction in February, showing incorrect number of days while maintaining correct underlying calculation.
findings.issue_explanation: The system displays remarks using 31 days for February instead of the correct 29 days in a leap year, despite performing accurate deduction calculations.
findings.limitation_statement: Remarks field does not dynamically adjust to actual calendar days for different months, particularly February in leap years.
findings.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on actual month days.

findings.group_description: Global daily rate configuration overrides individual leave policy calculations for unpaid leave deductions
findings.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions using gross salary instead of basic salary
findings.limitation_statement: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists
findings.gap_statement: The platform lacks flexibility in handling nuanced leave policy configurations across different work schedules

findings.group_description: System displays daily rate from payroll processing month instead of leave occurrence month, causing user confusion
findings.issue_explanation: The daily rate displayed does not match the month when leave was actually taken, showing the rate from the payroll processing month instead of the leave occurrence month
findings.limitation_statement: The system recalculates daily rates based on payroll processing month instead of storing the original leave occurrence month rate
findings.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time

troubleshooting.group_description: Workaround for lack of automated daily wage calculation
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime, tracked separately for each employee

troubleshooting.group_description: Users should double-check EOS calculations and report discrepancies to support
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Escalate to development team for precise calculation review

troubleshooting.group_description: Verifying total service days requires careful counting, including departure date and leap year days
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify total service days by counting: (1) Include departure date as last working day, (2) Account for leap year extra days, (3) Divide total days by 365 to calculate service years

troubleshooting.group_description: When discrepancies arise in gratuity calculations, manual verification of days and daily rate is recommended
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually break down calculation steps: verify total days worked, deduct unpaid leave, calculate years of service, apply correct daily rate

troubleshooting.group_description: When encountering discrepancies in leave salary calculation, users should review the leave policy configuration and understand the system's calculation logic.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Check the daily rate configuration in the leave policy, verify the divisor setting, and confirm the policy-driven calculation method.

troubleshooting.group_description: Manually aligning leave salary and salary proration daily wage configurations to match client expectations.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Verify and configure both leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations to use consistent divisors and formulas.

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual steps to verify and potentially correct salary proration for offboarded employees
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary by dividing monthly salary by 30 days and multiplying by days worked up to departure date

troubleshooting.group_description: When encountering discrepancies in daily wage calculator remarks, verify the actual deduction amount to confirm calculation accuracy.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Verify global daily rate settings before investigating policy-level calculation discrepancies

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving confusion around daily rate calculation and display across different payroll months
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: The system deployed a fix to store the initially calculated daily rate and display that amount instead of recalculating it every time

glossary.definition: Days configured as working in an employee's work week configuration, which may include all 7 days of the week depending on the specific work week policy.
Proportional salary calculation for partial month based on basic salary plus allowances divided by 30 days
Final salary settlement for an employee leaving the company, calculated based on their total service period
End of service benefit calculated based on employee's length of service, typically computed by multiplying daily wage by a factor depending on years of service
Total number of days worked, including departure date, calculated by counting actual calendar days and dividing by 365 to determine service years
Calculating salary proportionally based on the number of working days in a given period, determined by the employee's configured work week.
A configurable setting in the leave policy that determines how daily wage is calculated, typically set to a fixed number of days (e.g., 30 or 31) used to prorate salary for leave periods.
Partial salary calculation based on the exact number of days worked in a month, typically used when an employee starts or leaves mid-month
A system configuration that divides monthly salary to calculate daily wage, using 30.42 days instead of calendar days for leave and payroll calculations.
Calculation of salary reduction based on number of days an employee is absent without pay, using daily rate divided by actual calendar days in the month.
Method of calculating daily wage by dividing salary (basic or gross) by total working days

claims_to_validate.title: daily wage remarks display
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculator displays a remarks field that may show incorrect number of days for monthly calculations.
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Payroll → Daily Wage Calculator → Unpaid Leave Deduction
steps: Check remarks field for day calculation
expected: Remarks field is visible
Remarks may not always reflect accurate calendar days

claims_to_validate.title: gratuity calculation manual edit
claims_to_validate.statement: Gratuity calculation allows manual user editing of the automatically generated amount
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Daily Wage Calculator → Gratuity Calculation Section
expected: User can modify the system-generated gratuity amount
No immediate validation warning appears

claims_to_validate.title: global configuration precedence
claims_to_validate.statement: Global daily rate configuration takes precedence over policy-level leave calculation settings
expected: Global setting controls calculation method

claims_to_validate.title: daily rate initial calculation preservation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily rate is stored at the time of initial calculation and not recalculated on subsequent displays
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Payroll → Leave Deduction → Daily Rate Display
steps: Create leave request in specific month
Verify daily rate matches original leave month
expected: Daily rate shows calculation from original leave occurrence month
Rate does not change when viewed in different payroll month

claims_to_validate.title: daily wage formula read only
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculation formula is displayed as read-only and cannot be edited by users
expected: Daily wage formula is visible
Formula input is disabled
User cannot modify calculation method

claims_to_validate.title: daily wage calculation field
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculation involves basic salary and allowances components
expected: Basic salary and allowances fields are present

claims_to_validate.title: daily wage proration calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculator can prorate salary when departure date is in the past, but fails when departure date is in the future
indicators: Salary calculation varies based on departure date timing
steps: Select employee with past departure date
Select employee with future departure date
expected: Prorated salary calculated correctly for past departure dates
Inconsistent proration for future departure dates
selector_hints: Salary calculation varies based on departure date timing

claims_to_validate.title: leave encashment config selection
claims_to_validate.statement: When configuring leave encashment, users can select between 'working days' and 'custom days' calculation methods.
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Daily Wage Calculator → Leave Encashment Settings
expected: Both options 'working days' and 'custom days' are available

claims_to_validate.title: work week configuration access
claims_to_validate.statement: Users can access an employee's Work Week configuration related to daily wage calculation.
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Payroll → Employee Configuration → Work Week Settings
expected: Work Week Settings screen is navigable
Configuration options for work days are visible

claims_to_validate.title: daily wage divisor configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage divisor is configured at policy level and cannot be overridden per individual employee
expected: Divisor is set at policy level
No per-employee divisor override option

claims_to_validate.title: daily rate divisor no override
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave Policy settings do not provide a UI option to override the Daily Rate Divisor at employee level or per leave request; the divisor is policy-driven only.
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: HR Settings → Leave Policies → Daily Rate Configuration
indicators: Divisor is defined at policy level
steps: Navigate to HR Settings → Leave Policies
Open a policy and locate Daily Rate Configuration
Confirm there is no option labeled override/custom/employee-specific for divisor
expected: Daily Rate Divisor is configurable at policy level
No override option exists at employee or request level
selector_hints: Divisor is defined at policy level
